L2_gloss: The first letter of the Kaingang alphabet, written in the Latin script.

to cut both sides (of)
2011, Ursula Gojtéj Wiesemann, Dicionário Kaingang-Português Português-Kaingang, 2nd edition, Editora Esperança, page 54:
Vãn kukre han ra!
Cut both sides of the bamboo!
table (item of furniture with a flat top surface raised
To warm oneself by staying near a fire.[1]

to knock a fruit down from a tree
2011, Ursula Gojtéj Wiesemann, Dicionário Kaingang-Português Português-Kaingang, 2nd edition, Editora Esperança, page 92:
Fág vánvan ag tóg nỹtĩ.
They are knocking down Paraná pine nuts.
a trap with corn as bait
a path opened by an animal[1]
